agency_desc: Provides coordinated efforts to help homeless families regain their housing, their independence, and their dignity.

nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for registration. -- Forms may be downloaded from the website.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm -- Therapy: Year-round, Mon-Fri hours vary
site_eligibility: Individuals age 4 or older -- Individuals with physical disabilities -- Individuals with intellectual disabilities -- Individuals with emotional and behavioral disabilities -- Individuals with social disabilities -- Individuals must meet weight restrictions (case-by-case; determined by assessment)

site_details: Call to schedule transportation at least 24 hours in advance. Specify whether a wheelchair-accessible vehicle is required. Be advised provider may be available outside regular hours; call for more details.
site_eligibility: Living in Hamilton or in zip codes 46250 or 46256 in Marion County -- Individuals who are unable to travel independently -- Individuals with standard wheelchairs and scooters up to 500 pounds

agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides comprehensive foot care for patients in assisted living and independent living facilities as well as those in private homes who have a difficult time getting to the doctor's office.

site_details: Call to schedule home visit. Be prepared to provide primary physician's name, address and phone number, date of last doctor's visit, allergies, current medications, medical history, and insurance information.
site_eligibility: Living in Hamilton, Johnson, and Marion County -OR- Living in the cities of Lebanon, Whitestown, and Zionsville in Boone County; Greenfield, McCordsville, and New Palestine in Hancock County; Avon, Brownsburg, Danville, and Plainfield in Hendricks County; and Morristown, New Castle, Shelbyville in Shelby County --Difficulty getting to doctor's office
